title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

arkub joined #xwiki at 11:29  
sburjan - (11:31): vmassol: I am aware of there (saw them yesterday)  
sburjan - (11:31): problem is that changing means it will be global  
sburjan - (11:32): not just per code macro  
vmassol - (11:32): sburjan: comment on the issue if you have comments  
vmassol - (11:32): (I'm not working on this and I don't even know how pygments work)  
xwikibottest joined #xwiki at 11:43  
xwikibottest - (11:47): IRC.IRCConfig was modified by XWiki.Admin  - http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/IRCConfig  
vmassol - (11:47): sburjan: could you play in another channel ? :)  
sburjan - (11:48): yes, sorry  
xwikibottest left at 11:48 (Remote host closed the connection  
vmassol - (11:48): sburjan: I'm getting stressed that people make changes to xwiki.org  
vmassol - (11:48): when I see your notifications  
sburjan - (11:49): well the URL is localhost :)  
tapaya joined #xwiki at 12:01  
cjdelisle` - (12:02): vmassol, any questions re: "[proposal] Filesystem based attachment storage."  
tapaya left #xwiki at 12:05  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 12:05  
sburjan - (12:08): vmassol: http://xwikisoftware.iasi.rdsnet.ro:8080/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20101203 do you like it ?  
vmassol - (12:09): cjdelisle`: well i have archietcture questions, like: how would this integrate if we were to choose a JCR implementation knowing that JCR supports file system storage, etc but it's not important right now I think  
cjdelisle` - (12:09): There's nothing about TransactionRunnable which bans JCR.  
vmassol - (12:10): sburjan: nice!  
sburjan - (12:10): vmassol: although I am not 100% produ is fhte coloring style pygments does here  
cjdelisle` - (12:10): Unless JCR allows you to have one workspace which is filesystem backed and one which is database backed, I don't think we have much to worry about with wanting to store attachments along side searchable content.  
vmassol - (12:11): cjdelisle`: yes it does  
vmassol - (12:11): it's per workspace  
vmassol - (12:11): (in jackrabbit, AFAIR)  
cjdelisle` - (12:11): Ok then it might replace this but I don't see it happening tomorrow (dead horse, I'll stop now.)  
vmassol - (12:11): yep  
cjdelisle` - (12:12): Do I have your +1?  
tmortagne - (12:14): sburjan: on http://xwikisoftware.iasi.rdsnet.ro:8080/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20101203 "has joined #xwiki" kind of messages are not always fomated the same way so some are highligted and some are not  
tmortagne - (12:15): for example the one at 12:03  
tmortagne - (12:15): is highlighted  
vmassol - (12:15): cjdelisle`: yep  
tmortagne - (12:16): would be nicer if it was done the same than the one at 11:21  
sburjan - (12:16): tmortagne: that was fixed in the meantime  
cjdelisle` - (12:16): great. I want to wait until 2.7 is branched and bring this in for 3.0 which will give me some time to work on dns-p2p :D  
tmortagne - (12:16): sburjan: ok great  
sburjan - (12:16): tmortagne: check 12:43 xwikibottext has joined  
sburjan - (12:17): and you can see the 12:10 line where vmassol is coloured in evalica's line, but you can barely see it  
tmortagne - (12:17): sburjan: actually what i mean is that it would be better if it was not highlighted  
cjdelisle` - (12:17): oh btw, sburjan Mr. Network man, #dns-p2p@efnet, #dns-p2p-dev@efnet we're redesigning the internet.  
tmortagne - (12:18): so that we see the difference between technical and real conversation  
sburjan - (12:19): tmortagne: so joins, parts, quits shouldn't be highlighted ? Because if you want to do that, I have to change formatting on joins, quits, parts so the colourer won't get them  
sburjan - (12:20): so basically we have to chose between 11:12 (first line) and 12:09 for example  
tmortagne - (12:20): sburjan: i think it would be better yes, when it's not hilighted like at 11:18 you eyes just more easily over it  
sburjan - (12:20): maybe I should send a new proposal  
tmortagne - (12:20): s/just/jump/  
vmassol - (12:21): sburjan: no need, just do whatever you think is best  
tmortagne - (12:21): (in fact i would have prefered to not have it at all in the log)  
vmassol - (12:21): I don't think we need to discuss this for too long....  
tmortagne - (12:21): yep  
sburjan - (12:21): vmassol: me neither, but I want to make everybody happy  
tmortagne - (12:21): i suggest what i find better for me but if you are not convinced so whatever you feel is right  
tmortagne - (12:22): s/so/do/  
tmortagne - (12:22): it's already great like that  
sburjan - (12:23): well not highlighting joins/parts would break the formatting consistency in those lines. So it's a trade off .. colour vs formatting :)

sburjan - (13:48): vmassol: what is the purpose of extensions wiki ? to merge macros, appz, plugins in one page ?  
vmassol - (13:49): yes to have a single "type"  
sburjan - (13:50): and after, these from  code.xwiki.org will be removed from there ?  
vmassol - (13:51): yes  
vmassol - (13:51): jerome is doing the migration script  
vmassol - (13:51): we'll need your help at some point  
vmassol - (13:51): to help review the migrated pages  
vmassol - (13:51): (since the migration script will not be 100% perfect)

sburjan - (13:56): and to have a patch for next week

sburjan - (14:53): but it's actually from the API  
cjdelisle` - (15:08): vmassol, did you see the reply about ~this?  
vmassol - (15:08): cjdelisle`: did you see mine to yours?  
cjdelisle` - (15:08): hmm. reloading mail...  
sdumitriu left at 15:10 (Quit: Leaving.

cjdelisle` - (15:10): vmassol, ^  
vmassol - (15:11): I don't have much tiume to discuss it right now but basically my proposal is supposed to work with nested spaces and whatever the name of the document

cjdelisle` - (15:11): Are you -1 to my proposal?  
vmassol - (15:12): not the whole thing  
vmassol - (15:12): just the ~this part  
cjdelisle` - (15:12): What is wrong with it?  
sburjan - (15:15): ok guys. i think I have found a scenario. Is someone running on 2.6 final ?  
sburjan - (15:15): (and also wanting to confirm)  
sburjan - (15:19): okay, talk laters  
sburjan left at 15:21 (Quit: Ex-Chat  
sabageru joined #xwiki at 15:25  
cjdelisle` - (15:27): vmassol, sent reply with an example of a collision in your proposal. There are a lot of issues with it which will cause files to end up grouped in odd ways, that is an actual collision which will throw an exception.  
cjdelisle` - (15:28): What is unacceptable about ~this?

rrodriguez left at 19:10 (Quit: rrodriguez  
MartinBryant joined #xwiki at 19:11  
MartinBryant - (19:12): Hey guys i was wondering if any of you could kind of give me a quick overview of what th relational option in static list and DB list does.  
cjdelisle` - (19:12): sure.  
cjdelisle` - (19:12): When you use relational storage, each element in the list becomes a row in the database.  
cjdelisle` - (19:13): When you turn off relational storage, the list is stored as a LargeStringProperty which looks like "element1|element2|element3"  
cjdelisle` - (19:14): So if you want to search for a list containing a given element, you turn relational storage on and then your search will look something like:  
cjdelisle` - (19:15): argh. I'd have to look at the documentation to craft the correct query.  
cjdelisle` - (19:16): The point is you can search for lists by their contents and it will be relitively fast.  
MartinBryant - (19:17): ah I see that helps alot, i was curious as to what it did to the DB.. and if you have a moment i have another inquiry as well.  
cjdelisle` - (19:17): sure  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 19:17  
MartinBryant - (19:17): I am trying to write a xwql query using the query manager to search of all pages given a specific tag...  at this point I can get all the pages that have tags, but i cant seem to limit the page list to a specific tag  
MartinBryant - (19:18): my query currently looks like this:  
MartinBryant - (19:18): #set($results = $services.query.xwql("from doc.object(XWiki.TagClass) as tagObj where tagObj.tag='Person'").execute())  
MartinBryant - (19:18): if I remove the where tagObj.... out i get the list of all the pages that have tags  
cjdelisle` - (19:19): hmm. I'm not much of an expert on xwql.  
MartinBryant - (19:19): sorry tagObj.tags\* and i get a velocity error not an empty query  
MartinBryant - (19:20): well how about HQL?  
cjdelisle` - (19:20): I can do that a bit better.  
MartinBryant - (19:20): at this point I just kind of need to prove that I can do it  
cjdelisle` - (19:21): this is the schema mapping. When you are doing complex queries it is your best friend. http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/resources/xwiki.hbm.xml  
cjdelisle` - (19:23): ok, if you have set tags to use relational storage then you will have to use a different query.  
MartinBryant - (19:23): they are  
cjdelisle` - (19:24): When did you make the change? I think tags which predate the change are not ported unitl they are saved again.  
MartinBryant - (19:25): it was relational by default  
cjdelisle` - (19:25): ok good.  
cjdelisle` - (19:25): You want documents containing that tag right?  
MartinBryant - (19:25): correct  
cjdelisle` - (19:28): $xwiki.searchDocuments(", BaseObject obj, DBStringListProperty prop where obj.name=doc.fullName and prop.id=obj.id and prop.list.value='Person'")  
cjdelisle` - (19:28): I'm not 100% on that prop.list.value  
MartinBryant - (19:28): yea i was curious about that, I think i remember somewhere if multi select was on, list values were no longer a string type  
MartinBryant - (19:29): and I couldnt remember the type or how to declare it  
cjdelisle` - (19:30): I think if multi select is off, it's a string.  
cjdelisle` - (19:30): If multi select is on, it's a largeString  
cjdelisle` - (19:30): if relational is on, it's a DBStringListProperty  
MartinBryant - (19:32): I appreciate it that has helped me more than you know.. sometimes i feel a bit in over my head..  
MartinBryant - (19:32): sadly that query is not working and i think it may be that prop.list.value like you suggested  
jvdrean left at 19:33 (Quit: Leaving.  
cjdelisle` - (19:33): I'm fishing through the hql documentation to see how to query elements in a list...  
sabageru joined #xwiki at 19:33  
cjdelisle` - (19:46): I think this is the query you're after:  
cjdelisle` - (19:46): $xwiki.searchDocuments(", BaseObject obj, DBStringListProperty prop where obj.name=doc.fullName and prop.id=obj.id and 'Person' in elements(prop.list)")  
MartinBryant - (20:07): thanks I will give that a try  
MartinBryant - (20:09): that worked fantastic... thank you  
cjdelisle` - (20:09): no pb

cjdelisle` - (22:36): hah thanks for pointing out AutoCloseInputStream. I did a little googling for Close at end InputStream and nothing so I wroter it.  
sdumitriu - (22:37): I'm lazy, so I always search in org.apache.commons for something before I write it  
cjdelisle` - (22:38): I write too much but then i like to know exactly what something does so often I either write it or read it.  
cjdelisle` - (22:38): WDYT about the proposal?
